Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Allomyrinasin (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCLL1c; BBL)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (35.7%) torumen microbiome P23. GRAVY: 1.05.Toxicity: Potent against E. coli and S. aureus, weak against P. acnes, S. epidermidis, and C. albicans. It reduced the nitric oxide and cytokine production of the lipopolysaccharide-induced Raw264.7 cells. It binds LPS.
Literature Information.Author: Lee JH, Seo M, Lee HJ, et al. 2019
Literature Information.Reference: J Microbiol Biotechnol  29 (5), 687-695 2019 May 28. PMID: 30955257 DOI: 10.4014/jmb.1809.09031.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Anti-Inflammatory Activity of Antimicrobial Peptide Allomyrinasin Derived From the Dynastid Beetle, Allomyrina dichotoma
